newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Microtek up in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Microtek up in late trade.

text.p: Taiwan's Microtek International rose sharply in late session on Tuesday as sound sales expectations for the firm encouraged investors to place large buying orders, brokers said.
With 55 minutes left, Microtek was up 3.17 percent or T$1.30 to T$42.30. Trade volume was a heavy 21.84 million shares.
Microtek is Taiwan's leading computer image scanner maker.
Brokers said investors expected sales for Taiwan's electronic firms to rise in the fourth quarter in 1996.

"Many blue-chip electronic firms have been taking turns rising recently because of the sound outlook for the sector, and today major investors decided to target Microtek," said Oliver Fang of National Securities.
